pros: Willowbrook was a great company to work for. Everyone from management to regular staff were kind and compassionate!
cons: I didn't have any negative experienced while working there.

job_title: Patient Care Assistant (PCA) in Columbus, OH
pros: Working with the residents. Meaningful work. Plenty of hours. Benefits. Fair pay.
cons: Physical, often providing skilled care even in assisted living. Demanding. No incentives. Could be better pay for the amount of work.

review_title: Good first job, and that’s it.
pros: Residents are nice, coworkers are pretty good, people are getting better closing/opening. 3 dollar weekend premium is pretty good.
cons: Man does the pay suck. This is a job for high schoolers and that’s it. I don’t understand how they plan to have people work the 6:00 shift with this abysmal pay. You could go to Wendy’s and get more money. If you’re a high schooler, this is a decent job. If you are ANY OTHER demographic, LOOK ELSEWHERE.

review_title: Not in it for the money
job_title: State Tested Nursing Assistant (STNA) in Columbus, OH
pros: You can't do this job for the money, you do this job because you are born to help people
cons: Pay raises need to be enacted for employees.

pros: Wonderful working environment, you are not overloaded with residents, staff that cares for their residents. Clean, clean, clean. Educated staff and best CEO around. He is thankful for every employee and makes you feel welcome every time you see him.
cons: Some shifts could be a bit more caring and willing to work together. This has nothing to do with the company though.

review_title: Great opportunity to learn institutional cooking.
pros: Cook from scratch for their residents.
cons: Not much upward mobility in the Culinary Dept.

pros: Best nursing home in Ohio, very kind employees and patients that are very welcoming.
cons: eight hours shifts so you have to work almost everyday.

job_title: Life Enrichment Coordinator in Delaware, OH
pros: helping others, great team, free meals, benefits, room for advancement
cons: emotionally hard when residents you love pass away
